If I leverage or borrow against capital appreciation on unrealized gains and my net worth is over 100 million, then i'd pay a capital gains tax on unrealized gains, and I should.  "The ultra-wealthy are allowed to maintain ownership of appreciating assets ( unrealized gains ) while using the value of those assets to fund other investments or personal expenses.    Two key parts to this proposal: 100,000,000 net wealth and leveraging the unrealized capital gains, covers a pretty small group according to my AI search, .1% to be accurate.   Why are average americans, most without equity portfolio's at all against this fair proposal to tax unrealized gains for net worth over 100 million?
Chris, thank you for your insights on the election.  However, the question is as follows:  is ANET a buy here or a sell?

Here is a rundown of policy differences. This is not an endorsement.Mr. Trump recently stated that he supports reducing the top corporate income tax bracketfrom 21% to 15% in order to help companies like ANET to compete strongly against foreigncompetitors. 7 years ago, Mr. Trump spearheaded reducing the rate from 35% to 21%.Ms. Harris proposes increasing the top corporate rate from 21% to 28%, a 25% increase inincome tax ANET would have to pay instead of investing in it's growth.Mr. Trump wants to maintain the current long-term capital gains tax on sales of ANET stockat 15% and 20% for higher earners.Ms. Harris proposes taxing capital gains taxes as ordinary earnings. So an investor in the 28% marginal income tax bracket would see in increase in capital gains taxes on ANET stock sales from 15% to 28%, almost doubling the tax owed. Ms. Harris also proposes, with Mr. Biden,to impose the tax on "unrealized" gains, on ANET stock that an investor owns but has not yetsold. The unrealized gain tax would be imposed on higher earners.Mr. Trump lowered personal income tax brackets across the board in 2017. Those reductions will "sunset" (end) in 2025 if they are not renewed. Mr. Trump wants to renew them. Ms. Harris avoids the subject, but Mr. Biden has expressed disdain for the 2017 reductions. The increased standard deduction would also sunset. If the brackets sunset and increase to the pre-2017 levels, so too would the cap-gains tax with Harris's proposal.
